overview.content: Arthrosamid® is a polyacrylamide hydrogel composed of 97.5% water and 2.5% iPAAG. It integrates with the synovial membrane, permanently increasing viscosity and cushioning. Instead of washing out like hyaluronic acid, Arthrosamid becomes part of the joint lining, dampening inflammation and restoring shock absorption so stairs, hills, and long walks feel effortless again.

longDescription: Arthrosamid® is a next-generation polyacrylamide hydrogel made of 97.5% water and 2.5% inert polymer. Once injected, it intertwines with the synovial membrane to rebuild the squishy barrier your knee has lost. There is no washout, no steroid crash—just a gradual softening of pain over 4–12 weeks and documented relief out to 156 weeks. Dr Abbas performs every injection in Marylebone using ultrasound guidance so the hydrogel lands exactly where cushioning has thinned.

faq.question: How soon will I feel relief?
faq.answer: Most people feel subtle softness by week four with peak cushioning around the 12-week review as the hydrogel becomes part of the synovial lining.

faq.question: Is Arthrosamid® better than hyaluronic acid?
faq.answer: Hyaluronic acid washes out within months and requires multiple syringes. Arthrosamid uses a single 2.5 ml hydrogel that fuses with the synovial membrane for multi-year relief.

faq.question: How long can results last?
faq.answer: Clinical trials record significant WOMAC pain reduction at 156 weeks (three years). We schedule annual reviews to decide if you need any supporting therapy.

faq.question: What does recovery look like?
faq.answer: Expect 48 hours of reduced activity, gentle range-of-motion work, and then a structured physiotherapy plan to protect the new cushioning.

faq.question: Can I combine Arthrosamid® with PRP or stem cell therapy?
faq.answer: Yes. Many patients stack Arthrosamid® with PRP or adipose-derived stem cell therapy to rebuild tissue while the hydrogel provides cushioning.

detailedFeatures.title: The Science of Arthrosamid®
paragraphs: Arthrosamid® is a synovial scaffold permanently combining with the synovial lining / membrane in the knee which in early stage OA and severe OA becomes a cytokine storm of inflammatory cells causing stiffness and pain for patients.
Once injected, Arthrosamid takes up to 4-6 weeks and out to 3 months to have a clinical effect for patients, it is a physical, biological process.

Once the inert hydrogel is injected via ultrasound the natural filtering process of the synovium uptakes the hydrogel, becoming over time integrated, reducing inflammation and stiffness and improving elasticity of the joint.

To date 23,000 patients across the UK and Europe have been treated with 4 clinical studies demonstrating multiple years of sustained pain relief. 2 of the clinical studies demonstrating sustained pain relief for up to 5 years from a single injection.
